CAN: The student can draw simplistic shapes that might represent objects, but with minimal or no indication of the state of the material (e.g., a circle that could be interpreted as ice but lacks detail).
CANNOT: The student is unable to accurately depict ice melting into water, possibly showing unrelated transformations or forgetting to depict the process entirely *(student doesn't know or misunderstands the melting process)*.

The student does not demonstrate the concept of reversibility, failing to show water freezing back into ice or might depict an unrelated change *(student misunderstands concept of reversible changes)*.

The drawing lacks any representation of an irreversible change (e.g., cooking an egg), or misrepresents reversible changes as irreversible *(student cannot distinguish between reversible and irreversible changes)*.
